understanding.p: A documentation set (doc-set) is a collection of one or more related topic sets, each of which can use different schemas.

planning-question.planning-question-title: Do I need a documentation set?

planning-question-body.p: You need to define a documentation set to group related topic sets into a single documentation set.

how-to-answer-body.p: It is not necessary to create a collection of topic sets; you use a single topic set to include all your topics. However, if you use a documentation set, you can present multiple topic sets in a specific order in the table of contents in the output. A documentation set also enables you to reuse topic sets in different documentation sets.

doing.p: To add a documentation set, you define the /spfe/doc-set element in the main SPFE configuration file; you cannot include a doc-set definition in a separate file. You can only define one doc-set element; the build system ignores the subsequent definitions. A documentation set must have at least one topic set. You need the following mandatory attributes and elements:

li.p: /spfe/doc-set/@id: The name of the documentation set. The build system uses the value to create a directory name and it must be a valid directory name in the operating system that runs the build system.
/spfe/doc-set/title: The title of the documentation set to display in the output.

/spfe/doc-set/topic-set-type-order: The order in which you want to present the topic sets in the table of contents of the documentation set. Each topic set must define a /spfe/topic-set-type element that matches one of the values in this element.

/spfe/doc-set/topic-sets: The list of the topic sets to include in the documentation set. The value of the /spfe/doc-set/topic-sets@id attribute should match the /spfe/topic-set-id for the topic set and the /spfe/doc-set/topic-sets@href attribute is the URL of the topic set configuration file.

This documentation set includes three topic sets, each with their own configuration file, which is specified by the href attribute of the /spfe/doc-set/topic-sets/topic-set element. The path is relative to the location of the configuration file that defines the doc-set element. Each topic set configuration file defines a /spfe/topic-set-type element that matches one of the values in the /spfe/doc-set/topic-set-type-order element.

To add an index page for the documentation set, you need to add a topic set that includes an index topic and includes the topic set in the list of topic sets. For example, the topic set spfe-docs-docset contains the index topic for the SPFE documentation set.

Run the spfe build tool and specify the configuration file that contains the doc-set element as the first parameter. If you see the topic sets that your documentation set includes in the table of contents you have successfully added a documentation set.
